parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: (uuid) Databricks account ID of any type. For non-E2 account types, get your account ID from the

201.description: The storage configuration was successfully created.

401.description: The request does not have valid authentication credentials for the operation.

404.description: Operation was performed on a resource that does not exist.

requestBody.description: Properties of the new storage configuration.

post.description: Creates new storage configuration for an account, specified by ID. Uploads a storage configuration object that represents the root AWS S3 bucket in your account. Databricks stores related workspace assets including DBFS, cluster logs, and job results. For the AWS S3 bucket, you need to configure the required bucket policy.
